title: "Health Economics Overview"

## What Is Health Economics?

Health economics assesses the value of healthcare interventions, balancing clinical outcomes and resource use.

## Common Model Types

| Type                      | Description                              |
|---------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| Decision Tree             | Simple, single‑episode analysis          |
| Markov Model              | Chronic conditions with recurring states |
| Partitioned Survival      | Oncology and time‑to‑event data          |
| Discrete‑Event Simulation | Complex patient pathways                 |

## Key Metrics

-   **ICER** – Incremental Cost‑Effectiveness Ratio\
-   **NMB** – Net Monetary Benefit\
-   **CEAC** – Cost‑Effectiveness Acceptability Curve
